alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Colleton; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston, Colleton and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 556 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with torrential rainfall expanding across eastern portions of Colleton County into southern portions of Berkeley and Dorchester Counties. This storms will continue to move east through 8 PM and pose a risk for minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Walterboro, Ladson, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, West Ashley, Daniel Island, Givhans Ferry State Park, Hollywood, Ridgeville, Awendaw, Cottageville, College Park, Sangaree, Crowfield Plantation and Knightsville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
